body_html:
@skye Thank you for the comment.
I built it again from source code.
Let me fix my tensorflow version to
('v1.1.0-rc0-61-g1ec6ed5', '1.1.0')

@drpngx Thanks! I'll check this issue from your link.
For -lgcov, I'll leave a comment when I found the solution for MacOS.

By the way, I ran the bazel coverage command on my ubuntu machine to avoid -lgcov issue.
And I got another problem.

bazel coverage --test_strategy=standalone --test_output=streamed //tensorflow/tensorboard/backend:application_test --collect_code_coverage --instrumentation_filter=// --linkopt=--coverage --linkopt=-lgcov --linkopt=-lgcc --linkopt=-lc --nocache_test_results --test_output=all

And the error log is like below.

...
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 62 tests in 21.883s

OK
================================================================================
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/BUILD:73:1: output 'tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/application_test/coverage.dat' was not created.
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/BUILD:73:1: not all outputs were created or valid.
Target //tensorflow/tensorboard/backend:application_test up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/application_test
INFO: Elapsed time: 2082.067s, Critical Path: 1751.51s
//tensorflow/tensorboard/backend:application_test                        PASSED in 23.1s

Executed 1 out of 1 test: 1 test passes.
All tests passed but there were other errors during the build.

I found similar code coverage issue on bazel issues page.
bazelbuild/bazel#1118

It seems like they are trying solve this problem(coverage.dat was not created).

body:
@skye Thank you for the comment.
I built it again from source code.
Let me fix my tensorflow version to 
`('v1.1.0-rc0-61-g1ec6ed5', '1.1.0')`

@drpngx Thanks! I'll check this issue from your link.
For `-lgcov`, I'll leave a comment when I found the solution for MacOS.

By the way, I ran the `bazel coverage` command on my ubuntu machine to avoid `-lgcov` issue. 
And I got another problem.

```
bazel coverage --test_strategy=standalone --test_output=streamed //tensorflow/tensorboard/backend:application_test --collect_code_coverage --instrumentation_filter=// --linkopt=--coverage --linkopt=-lgcov --linkopt=-lgcc --linkopt=-lc --nocache_test_results --test_output=all
```

And the error log is like below.
```
...
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 62 tests in 21.883s

OK
================================================================================
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/BUILD:73:1: output 'tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/application_test/coverage.dat' was not created.
ERROR: /home/ubuntu/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/BUILD:73:1: not all outputs were created or valid.
Target //tensorflow/tensorboard/backend:application_test up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/tensorboard/backend/application_test
INFO: Elapsed time: 2082.067s, Critical Path: 1751.51s
//tensorflow/tensorboard/backend:application_test                        PASSED in 23.1s

Executed 1 out of 1 test: 1 test passes.
All tests passed but there were other errors during the build.
```

I found similar code coverage issue on bazel issues page.
https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/1118

It seems like they are trying solve this problem(`coverage.dat was not created`).
